titleStmt.title: J. G. Carlisle et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6342

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Covington Ky. April 13th/65
To the Hon/ Thomas E. Bramlett
Governor &c &c

The undersigned respectfully represent, that at the December Term 1864 of the Kenton Circuit Court, Frank Dickerson was Indicted and at the ensuing -- March Term 1865 was tried and convicted for carrying concealed a Pistol on the day of the Presidential election. He was fined Fifty dollars which together with the Costs amount to Sixty-one or two dollars -- Mr Dickerson is a worthy mechanic, peaceable and industrious -- he has a wife and children and is a very poor man. It will be a great relief to him to be discharged from so much of said Fine as belongs to the Com'th. We recommend him as worthy of Executive clemency and respectfully ask the Governor to remit his fine in the manner herein before stated.

Names:
J. G. Carlisle
J. O'Hara Jr
Chas G Wallace
J P Scott
Harvey Myers
Jno E. Hamilton
A. C. Ellis
B. W. Foley Jr.
J C Howard
M J Dudley
R Simmons
Geo T. Pulliam
W E Arthur
John F. Fisk
C. H. Mooar

Kenton Cir Ct
vs
Frank. Dickerson
To } Petition
$50.
The Governor
Remitted
15th Apl/65
